library(shiny) library(ggplot2) library(munsell) library(DT) library(htmlwidgets) library(plotly) # Wichtig für den interaktiven Plot # ========================================================== # MODUL DEFINITION: UI (Für einen einzelnen Athleten) # ========================================================== athleteModuleUI <- function(id, label = "Athlete") { ns <- NS(id) tagList( tags$head( tags$style(HTML(" /* 1. Regression Results -> Gelblich */ pre[id$='plot_info'] { background-color: #fff3cd !important; /* Helles Gelb */ color: black !important; /* Dunkelgelbe Schrift */ border: 1px solid #ffeeba !important; /* Gelber Rahmen */ font-weight: bold; } /* 2. Target Output (Vd Output) -> Bläulich */ pre[id$='vd_output'] { background-color: #d1ecf1 !important; /* Helles Blau */ color: #0c5460 !important; /* Dunkelblaue Schrift */ border: 1px solid #bee5eb !important; /* Blauer Rahmen */ font-weight: bold; } ")) ), sidebarLayout( sidebarPanel( h4("Athlete Info"), textInput(ns("athlete"), "Name", value = label), numericInput(ns("mass"), "Weight (kg)", value = 100, min = 30, max = 150, step = 0.01), hr(), # --- STEUERUNG FÜR TAB 2 (TRAINING) --- conditionalPanel( condition = paste0("input['", ns("main_tabs"), "'] == 'Training' || input['", ns("main_tabs"), "'] == 'Variable Loading'"), h4("Today's Performance"), helpText("Results of the Free Sprint today:"), numericInput(ns("daily_dist"), "Distance (m)", value = 30), numericInput(ns("daily_time"), "Time (s)", value = 4.40, step = 0.01), numericInput(ns("daily_vmax"), HTML("Vmax (m/s)"), value = 9.00, step = 0.01), hr(), p(em("The entered values combine the existing L-v Profile in the Profiling Tab with loaded sprints and update it with today's top speed.")) ) ), mainPanel( tabsetPanel(id = ns("main_tabs"), # ---------------------------------------------------------- # TAB 1: PROFILING # ---------------------------------------------------------- tabPanel("Profiling", br(), h3("1. Enter Data"), helpText(em(HTML("A standard of 10%, 20% and 30% of the ahtlete's weight is set and the loads are calculated accordingly. Values can be overwritten. Please enter the observed Vmax."))), # Tabelle mit Buttons (Copy, Excel, CSV) DTOutput(ns("lv_table")), br(), # Info Box (Regression Results) verbatimTextOutput(ns("plot_info")), h3("2. Profil Analysis"), # WICHTIG: plotlyOutput für Interaktivität plotlyOutput(ns("plot"), height = "600px"), br(), verbatimTextOutput(ns("vd_output")), br(), # Plot Settings (Wie im Original) wellPanel( h4("Plot Display Setting"), fluidRow( column(4, checkboxInput(ns("show_zones"), HTML("Display Vdec Zones"), value = FALSE)), column(4, checkboxInput(ns("show_power"), "Display Power curve", value = FALSE)), column(4, checkboxInput(ns("show_individual"), "Display Slider", value = FALSE)) ), conditionalPanel( condition = paste0("input['", ns("show_individual"), "'] == true"), hr(), sliderInput(ns("vd_slider"), HTML("Vdec (%)"), min = 0, max = 80, value = 50, step = 1, width = "100%") ) ), br(), hr(), h3("3. Prediction table"), helpText(em(HTML("Based on the Vinc/dec values for Load (kg), BW (%), and expected velocity (m/s) for that condition are displayed. A negative value for Vinc/dec would indicate a velocity increase (over speed)."))), DTOutput(ns("predict_table")), ), # ---------------------------------------------------------- # TAB 2: TRAINING # ---------------------------------------------------------- tabPanel("Training", br(), h3("Today's Session"), helpText(em(HTML("Based on the daily performance (left) and the L-v Profile, the recommended load and target velocity are presented.\n Please enter your targeted velocity decrease - Vdec (%)."))), br(), DTOutput(ns("training_table")), br(), h4(em("Information")), tags$ul( tags$li(strong(HTML("Target Vdec:")), " The targeted velocity decrement."), tags$li(strong("Rec. Load:"), " The recommended load based on the daily performance ",HTML("(vmax).")), tags$li(strong(HTML("Real Vdec:")), " Calculates the real decrement in velocity after the entry of data.") ) ), # ---------------------------------------------------------- # TAB 3: 1080 VARIABLE LOADING # ---------------------------------------------------------- tabPanel("Variable Loading", br(), h3("Variable Loading"), wellPanel( fluidRow( column(6, numericInput(ns("trans_perc"), HTML("Transition at % of Daily Vmax"), value = 90, step = 1), helpText(HTML("At which percentage (%) of today's Vmax should the target load be reached?")) ), column(6, numericInput(ns("end_load_input"), "Target Load (kg)", value = 1.0, step = 0.1, min = 0), helpText("The Target load is the load the user will feel when the speed reaches the preset target level (Target Speed).") ) ) ), hr(), br(), DTOutput(ns("variable_table")), br(), h4(em("Information")), p("The ", strong("Start load"), "is the load when the machine is idle and athlete is standing still.", "The System calculates the ", strong("Start Load"), HTML("based on the entered Vdec.")), p("The", strong("Target load"), "is the load the user will feel when the speed reaches the preset target level (Target Speed)."), p("The", strong("Target Speed"), "is the speed selected at which the Target Load will be reached. The lower the value, the sooner the Target Load resistance will be reached as the athlete accelerates."), em(HTML("Example: At a target speed of 90% of a 9.0 m/s Vmax, the target load (e.g., 1kg) is reached at 8.10 m/s.")) ) ) # HIER WURDE DER GLOBALE DOWNLOAD BUTTON ENTFERNT ) ) ) } # ========================================================== # MODUL DEFINITION: SERVER # ========================================================== athleteModuleServer <- function(id, initial_values = NULL) { moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) { # 1. DATEN & INITIALISIERUNG if (!is.null(initial_values) && !is.null(initial_values$mass)) { updateNumericInput(session, "mass", value = initial_values$mass) } default_df <- reactive({ bw_defaults <- c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA) vpeak_defaults <- c(9.22, 7.42, 5.72, 4.2, NA, NA) calc_mass <- input$mass if (!is.null(initial_values)) { if (!is.null(initial_values$BW)) bw_defaults <- initial_values$BW if (!is.null(initial_values$vpeak)) vpeak_defaults <- initial_values$vpeak if (!is.null(initial_values$mass)) calc_mass <- initial_values$mass } len <- max(length(bw_defaults), length(vpeak_defaults)) length(bw_defaults) <- len length(vpeak_defaults) <- len df <- data.frame( BW = as.numeric(bw_defaults), # Erzwinge numerisch Load = round(as.numeric(bw_defaults) * calc_mass / 100, 1), vpeak = as.numeric(vpeak_defaults) ) if (nrow(df) > 0) { df$BW[1] <- 1 df$Load[1] <- 1.0 } df }) rv <- reactiveValues(data = NULL) observe({ if (is.null(rv$data)) rv$data <- default_df() }) observeEvent(input$mass, { req(rv$data) df <- rv$data if("BW" %in% colnames(df)) { df$Load <- round(df$BW * input$mass / 100, 1) if (nrow(df) > 0) { df$BW[1] <- 1 df$Load[1] <- 1.0 } rv$data <- df } }, ignoreInit = TRUE) # ---------------------------------------------------------- # 2. TABELLE EDITIEREN (MIT BUTTONS) # ---------------------------------------------------------- output$lv_table <- renderDT({ req(rv$data) req(input$mass) datatable(rv$data, editable = TRUE, rownames = FALSE, colnames = c("BW (%)", "Load (kg)", "vmax (m/s)"), escape = FALSE, extensions = 'Buttons', options = list( dom = 'Bfrtip', buttons = c('copy', 'csv', 'excel'), # Buttons direkt an der Tabelle paging = FALSE, columnDefs = list(list(className = 'dt-center', targets = "_all")) ) ) %>% formatRound(columns = "vpeak", digits = 2) %>% formatRound(columns = "Load", digits = 1) }, server = FALSE) # WICHTIG: server = FALSE für Shinylive observeEvent(input$lv_table_cell_edit, { req(rv$data) if (nrow(rv$data) == 0) return() info <- input$lv_table_cell_edit df <- rv$data if (info$row > nrow(df)) return() if ((info$col + 1) > ncol(df)) return() col <- colnames(df)[info$col + 1] new_val <- suppressWarnings(as.numeric(info$value)) df[info$row, col] <- new_val if (col == "BW") df$Load <- round(df$BW * input$mass / 100, 1) rv$data <- df }) # ---------------------------------------------------------- # 3. REGRESSION ENGINE # ---------------------------------------------------------- regression <- reactive({ df <- rv$data df_clean <- df[complete.cases(df), ] if (nrow(df_clean) < 2) return(NULL) fit <- lm(vpeak ~ Load, data = df_clean) intercept <- coef(fit)[1] slope <- coef(fit)[2] r2 <- summary(fit)$r.squared max_load <- -intercept / slope list(df = df, fit = fit, intercept = intercept, slope = slope, r2 = r2, max_load = max_load) }) # ---------------------------------------------------------- # 4. PREDICTION TABLE # ---------------------------------------------------------- predict_df <- reactiveVal( data.frame( Vdec = unique(c(seq(-20, -2, by = 2.5), seq(5, 70, by = 5))), Load = NA_real_, BW_Percent = NA_real_, Velocity = NA_real_ ) ) observe({ reg <- regression() req(reg) df <- predict_df() df$Velocity <- reg$intercept * (1 - df$Vdec / 100) df$Load <- (df$Velocity - reg$intercept) / reg$slope df$BW_Percent <- (df$Load / input$mass) * 100 df <- df[, c("Vdec", "Load", "BW_Percent", "Velocity")] predict_df(df) }) output$predict_table <- renderDT({ datatable(predict_df(), editable = FALSE, rownames = FALSE, colnames = c("Vinc/dec (%)", "Load (kg)", "BW (%)", "Velocity (m/s)"), escape = FALSE, extensions = 'Buttons', # Auch hier Export ermöglichen options = list(dom = 'Bfrtip', buttons = c('copy', 'csv', 'excel'), paging = FALSE, columnDefs = list(list(className = 'dt-center', targets = "_all")))) %>% formatRound(columns = c('Load', 'Velocity', 'BW_Percent'), digits = 1) }, server = FALSE) # WICHTIG: server = FALSE # ---------------------------------------------------------- # 5. PLOT LOGIC (PLOTLY ADAPTION) # ---------------------------------------------------------- # Hier bauen wir den Plot genau wie im Original zusammen reactive_plot <- reactive({ reg <- regression() req(reg) df <- reg$df # Basis-Plot # Wir nutzen 'text' in aes(), um den Tooltip in Plotly hübsch zu machen p <- ggplot(df, aes(x = Load, y = vpeak)) y_limit_max <- max(df$vpeak, reg$intercept, na.rm=TRUE) * 1.1 x_max_val <- max(reg$max_load * 1.1, 30) # --- ZONES --- if (input$show_zones) { cuts_vdec <- seq(0, 80, by = 10) boundary_loads <- (-reg$intercept * (cuts_vdec / 100)) / reg$slope # KORREKTUR HIER: Statt -Inf/Inf nutzen wir 0 und y_limit_max rect_data <- data.frame( xmin = head(boundary_loads, -1), xmax = tail(boundary_loads, -1), ymin = 0, ymax = y_limit_max, Zone = factor(paste0(head(cuts_vdec, -1), "-", tail(cuts_vdec, -1), "%")) ) custom_colors <- c("springgreen4", "seagreen3", "palegreen1", "palegoldenrod", "salmon1", "tomato3", "firebrick3", "darkred") # Der Rest bleibt gleich p <- p + geom_rect(data = rect_data, aes(xmin = xmin, xmax = xmax, ymin = ymin, ymax = ymax, fill = Zone), inherit.aes = FALSE, alpha = 0.4) + scale_fill_manual(values = custom_colors, expression(V[dec])) + geom_rect(data = rect_data, aes(xmin = xmin, xmax = xmax, ymin = 0.7, ymax = 1.3), fill = "white", inherit.aes = FALSE, alpha = 0.7) y_top <- 1.0; tick_size <- 0.2 zone_labels <- data.frame(Label = c("Technical", "Speed-Strength", "Power", "Strength-Speed"), Vdec_Mid = c(5, 25, 50, 70)) zone_labels$x_pos <- (-reg$intercept * (zone_labels$Vdec_Mid / 100)) / reg$slope boundary_pct <- c(0, 10, 40, 60, 80) boundary_x <- (-reg$intercept * (boundary_pct / 100)) / reg$slope tick_data <- data.frame(x = boundary_x) p <- p + geom_text(data = zone_labels, aes(x = x_pos, y = y_top, label = Label), color = "black", fontface = "bold", size = 5, inherit.aes = FALSE) + geom_segment(data = tick_data, aes(x = x, xend = x, y = y_top - tick_size, yend = y_top + tick_size), color = "black", size = 0.8, inherit.aes = FALSE) } # --- REGRESSION LINE & POINTS --- line_df <- data.frame(Load = c(0, reg$max_load), vpeak = reg$intercept + reg$slope * c(0, reg$max_load)) # Tooltips für die Linie und Punkte definieren p <- p + geom_point(aes(text = paste("Load:", Load, "kg
Vel:", round(vpeak, 2), "m/s")), shape = 23, size = 3, fill = "black") + geom_line(data = line_df, aes(x = Load, y = vpeak, text = "L-v Profile"), color = "red3", linewidth = 1) + geom_line(color = "black", linetype = "dashed", alpha = 0.5, na.rm = TRUE) # --- POWER CURVE --- scaling_factor <- 1 if (input$show_power) { x_seq <- seq(0, reg$max_load, length.out = 100) y_vel <- reg$intercept + reg$slope * x_seq y_pow <- x_seq * 9.81 * y_vel max_pow_val <- max(y_pow, na.rm = TRUE) target_h <- y_limit_max * 0.8 scaling_factor <- max_pow_val / target_h power_breaks <- seq(0, max_pow_val + 250, by = 200) # Datensatz für Power power_df <- data.frame(Load = x_seq, PowerScaled = y_pow / scaling_factor, RealPower = y_pow) # KORREKTUR HIER: # 1. inherit.aes = FALSE (Ignoriert vpeak und Zones) # 2. group = 1 (Sagt Plotly: "Das ist EINE durchgehende Linie") p <- p + geom_line(data = power_df, aes(x = Load, y = PowerScaled, group = 1, text = paste("Power:", round(RealPower, 0), "W")), color = "black", linewidth = 0.7, linetype = "solid", inherit.aes = FALSE) } # --- INDIVIDUAL SLIDER POINT --- if (input$show_individual) { t_vel <- reg$intercept * (1 - input$vd_slider / 100) t_load <- (t_vel - reg$intercept) / reg$slope # Annotations für Slider p <- p + annotate("segment", x = 0, xend = t_load, y = t_vel, yend = t_vel, linetype = "dotdash", color = "blue3", linewidth = 0.7) + annotate("segment", x = t_load, xend = t_load, y = 0, yend = t_vel, linetype = "dotdash", color = "blue3", linewidth = 0.7) + annotate("point", x = t_load, y = t_vel, color = "blue3", size = 2) + annotate("text", x = 1.4, y = t_vel-0.3, label = paste0("-", input$vd_slider, "%"), hjust = -0.2, color = "blue3", fontface = "bold") + annotate("text", x = t_load + 2, y = 0.2, label = paste0(sprintf("%.1f", t_load), " kg"), hjust = -0.2, color = "blue3", fontface = "bold") } # --- ACHSEN & FORMATIERUNG --- x_breaks_custom <- seq(0, x_max_val, by = 5) # Power-Achse (sekundär) - Hinweis: Plotly unterstützt sec_axis nur eingeschränkt, # aber die Linie wird korrekt dargestellt. sec_axis_y_def <- if (input$show_power) sec_axis(~ . * scaling_factor, name = "Power [W]", breaks = power_breaks) else waiver() p <- p + theme_classic(base_size = 14) + # WICHTIG: expand = c(0,0) erzwingt Start bei 0 scale_x_continuous(breaks = x_breaks_custom, limits = c(0, x_max_val), expand = c(0, 0)) + scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, y_limit_max), breaks = seq(0, 15, by = 0.5), expand = c(0, 0), sec.axis = sec_axis_y_def) + # WICHTIG: coord_cartesian mit expand = FALSE ist der stärkste Zwang für 0,0 coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0, x_max_val), ylim = c(0, y_limit_max), expand = FALSE) + labs(title = paste("Load–Velocity Profile -", input$athlete), x = "Load (kg)", y = "Velocity (m/s)") + theme(plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold.italic"), axis.title = element_text(face = "italic"), legend.position = "none") # Legende stört im interaktiven Plot oft # Der untere %BW Strip ist in Plotly schwer umzusetzen, da patchwork nicht unterstützt wird. # Wir fokussieren uns auf den Hauptplot, da dort alle Infos sind. p }) # OUTPUT: INTERAKTIVER PLOTLY PLOT output$plot <- renderPlotly({ p <- reactive_plot() # Umwandlung in Plotly # tooltip="text" sorgt dafür, dass nur unsere formatierten Texte (aus aes(text=...)) angezeigt werden ggplotly(p, tooltip = "text") %>% config(displayModeBar = TRUE, displaylogo = FALSE, modeBarButtonsToRemove = c("lasso2d", "select2d")) %>% layout(margin = list(b = 40, l = 60)) # Ränder anpassen }) output$plot_info <- renderPrint({ reg <- regression(); req(reg) cat("Regression Results:\n-------------------\n", "L0 (Max Load) : ", sprintf("%.1f", reg$max_load), " kg\n", "v0 (Intercept): ", sprintf("%.2f", reg$intercept), " m/s | ", sprintf("%.1f", reg$intercept*3.6), " km/h\n", "Slope: ", sprintf("%.4f", reg$slope), "\n", "R²: ", sprintf("%.3f", reg$r2), "\n", sep = "") }) output$vd_output <- renderPrint({ reg <- regression(); req(reg) t_vel <- reg$intercept * (1 - input$vd_slider / 100); t_load <- (t_vel - reg$intercept) / reg$slope cat("Target Velocity : ", sprintf("%.2f", t_vel), " m/s\n", "Target Load (kg): ", sprintf("%.1f", t_load), " kg\n", " equals: ", sprintf("%.1f", t_load / input$mass*100), " %BW\n", sep = "") }) # ---------------------------------------------------------- # 6. TRAINING REGRESSION & TABLE # ---------------------------------------------------------- daily_regression <- reactive({ req(input$daily_vmax, rv$data) original <- rv$data; clean <- original[complete.cases(original), ] if(nrow(clean) > 1) { load_data <- clean[-1, ]; daily_point <- data.frame(BW = 0, Load = 1, vpeak = input$daily_vmax) training_data <- rbind(daily_point[, c("Load", "vpeak")], load_data[, c("Load", "vpeak")]) fit <- lm(vpeak ~ Load, data = training_data) return(list(intercept = coef(fit)[1], slope = coef(fit)[2])) } return(NULL) }) rv_training <- reactiveValues( df = data.frame(Vdec_Target = rep(NA_real_, 10), Rec_Load = rep(NA_real_, 10), Target_Vel = rep(NA_real_, 10), Dist = rep(NA_real_, 10), Time = rep(NA_real_, 10), Real_Vmax = rep(NA_real_, 10), Real_Vdec = rep(NA_real_, 10)) ) output$training_table <- renderDT({ datatable(rv_training$df, editable = TRUE, rownames = TRUE, colnames = c("Target Vdec (%)", "Rec. Load (kg)", "Target Vel (m/s)", "Distance (m)", "Time (s)", "Real Vmax (m/s)", "Real Vdec (%)"), escape = FALSE, extensions = 'Buttons', options = list(dom = 'Bfrtip', buttons = c('copy', 'csv', 'excel'), paging = FALSE, columnDefs = list(list(className = 'dt-center', targets = "_all")))) %>% formatRound(columns = c("Rec_Load", "Target_Vel", "Real_Vmax", "Real_Vdec"), digits = 2) %>% formatRound(columns = "Rec_Load", digits = 1) %>% formatStyle('Real_Vdec', 'Vdec_Target', backgroundColor = styleEqual(NA, 'white'), color = 'black') }, server = FALSE) # WICHTIG: server = FALSE observeEvent(input$training_table_cell_edit, { info <- input$training_table_cell_edit; df <- rv_training$df; daily_reg <- daily_regression() row_idx <- info$row; col_idx <- info$col; new_val <- as.numeric(info$value) df[row_idx, col_idx] <- new_val if (col_idx == 1 && !is.null(daily_reg) && !is.na(new_val)) { t_vel <- daily_reg$intercept * (1 - new_val / 100); t_load <- round((t_vel - daily_reg$intercept) / daily_reg$slope, 1) df[row_idx, 2] <- t_load; df[row_idx, 3] <- t_vel; df[row_idx, 4] <- 30 } if (col_idx == 6 && !is.null(daily_reg) && !is.na(new_val)) { v0_today <- daily_reg$intercept; real_vdec <- (1 - new_val / v0_today) * 100; df[row_idx, 7] <- real_vdec } rv_training$df <- df }) # --- TAB 3: 1080 VARIABLE LOADING --- rv_variable <- reactiveValues(df = data.frame(Start_Vdec = rep(NA_real_, 10), Start_Load = rep(NA_real_, 10), End_Load = rep(1.0, 10), Trans_Vel = rep(NA_real_, 10), Dist = rep(NA_real_, 10), Time = rep(NA_real_, 10), Real_Vmax = rep(NA_real_, 10))) output$variable_table <- renderDT({ datatable(rv_variable$df, editable = TRUE, rownames = TRUE, colnames = c("Start Vdec (%)", "Start Load (kg)", "Target Load (kg)", "Target Speed (m/s)", "Distance (m)", "Time (s)", "Real Vmax (m/s)"), escape = FALSE, extensions = 'Buttons', options = list(dom = 'Bfrtip', buttons = c('copy', 'csv', 'excel'), paging = FALSE, columnDefs = list(list(className = 'dt-center', targets = "_all")))) %>% formatRound(columns = c("Trans_Vel", "Real_Vmax"), digits = 2) %>% formatRound(columns = c("Start_Load", "End_Load"), digits = 1) }, server = FALSE) # WICHTIG: server = FALSE observeEvent(input$variable_table_cell_edit, { info <- input$variable_table_cell_edit; df <- rv_variable$df; daily_reg <- daily_regression() df[info$row, info$col] <- as.numeric(info$value) if (info$col == 1 && !is.null(daily_reg) && !is.na(df[info$row, 1])) { t_vel_start <- daily_reg$intercept * (1 - df[info$row, 1] / 100) df[info$row, 2] <- round((t_vel_start - daily_reg$intercept) / daily_reg$slope, 1) df[info$row, 5] <- 40; df[info$row, 4] <- input$daily_vmax * (input$trans_perc / 100) if(is.na(df[info$row, 3])) df[info$row, 3] <- input$end_load_input } rv_variable$df <- df }) }) } # ========================================================== # MAIN APPLICATION # ========================================================== ui <- navbarPage("L-V Profiling System", tabPanel("Paul P.", athleteModuleUI("athlete1", "Paul Panglisch")), tabPanel("Anton", athleteModuleUI("athlete2", "Anton Müller")), tabPanel("Eric", athleteModuleUI("athlete3", "Eric Zerau")), tabPanel("Paul G.", athleteModuleUI("athlete4", "Paul Grave")), tabPanel("Max", athleteModuleUI("athlete5", "Max Kuhn")), tabPanel("Nicola", athleteModuleUI("athlete6", "Nicola Volk")), tabPanel("Hermano", athleteModuleUI("athlete7", "Max Müller")), tabPanel("Athlete 8", athleteModuleUI("athlete8", "Athlete 8")) ) server <- function(input, output, session) { athlete_data <- list( athlete1 = list(mass = 98, BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(8.38, 6.55, 4.48, 3.26, NA, NA)), athlete2 = list(mass = 71, BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(8.39, 7.11, 5.61, 3.88, NA, NA)), athlete3 = list(mass = 86, BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(7.64, 6.29, 4.42, 3.45, NA, NA)), athlete4 = list(mass = 82, BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(8.13, 6.34, 4.86, 3.35, NA, NA)), athlete5 = list(mass = 83, BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(8.03, 6.19, 3.78, 2.19, NA, NA)), athlete6 = list(mass = 114,BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(8.46, 7.02, 5.30, 4.34, NA, NA)), athlete7 = list(mass = 86, BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(8.56, 7.29, 5.04, 3.67, NA, NA)), athlete8 = list(BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(9.20, 7.40, 5.70, 4.2, NA, NA)) ) athleteModuleServer("athlete1", athlete_data$athlete1) athleteModuleServer("athlete2", athlete_data$athlete2) athleteModuleServer("athlete3", athlete_data$athlete3) athleteModuleServer("athlete4", athlete_data$athlete4) athleteModuleServer("athlete5", athlete_data$athlete5) athleteModuleServer("athlete6", athlete_data$athlete6) athleteModuleServer("athlete7", athlete_data$athlete7) athleteModuleServer("athlete8", athlete_data$athlete8) } shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
